newsitem.title: CANADA: Loewen stock hit amid share issue fears.
newsitem.headline: Loewen stock hit amid share issue fears.

text.p: Shares in Loewen Group Inc extended a recent slide on Tuesday as investors anticipated a stock offering from the funeral home operator in coming months, analysts and traders said.

Loewen was off 5/8 at 28-7/8 on the New York Stock Exchange after breaching the closely watched 30 threshhold last Friday. In Toronto, the stock dropped 0.90 to 40.10, its lowest level since last summer.

The company filed a shelf registration last month with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for US$1 billion in stock and debt offerings, which it said should cover one to two years of its financing needs.
Traders and analysts said today that expectations of an offering soon were depressing Loewen shares, as were general market weakness and investor jitters.
"Clearly the stock has been under pressure due to the overhang of stock offerings. And there's the overall market pullback too," one New York trader said.

A company spokesman had no immediate comment on the stock weakness. Loewen's chief financial officer and investor relations specialist were meeting with major institutions this week in the United States.
Traders said the series of meetings seemed to add credence to talk that a stock issue might be forthcoming within the next month or two.

Raymond James analyst Susan Little said the meetings might be aimed at testing investor appetite for a share offering. The share price weakness signalled "investors are anticipating an equity offering in the near future."
